# OLED1306

Stub of module which adds support for SSD1306 OLED screens. Based
on [framebuf driver version](https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_CircuitPython_SSD1306/).

Works with `bitbangio`. Interaction with screen is slower than I expected and affect key input in Scenes, which reacts
to keypresses.

### Example usage

```python
import bitbangio as io

i2c = io.I2C(scl=board.D3, sda=board.D2, frequency=400000)

from kmk.extensions.oled_1306 import DisplayOLED, LogoScene, StatusScene, KeypressesScene
from micropython import const

layers_names = ['Colemak-DH', 'QWERTY', 'Sym-Nav', 'Number', 'Function']
kyria_logo = const(
    )
scenes = [
    LogoScene(kyria_logo),
    KeypressesScene(matrix_width=16, matrix_height=4, split=True),
    StatusScene(layers_names=layers_names, separate_default_layer=True, rgb_ext=rgb_ext),
]
oled = DisplayOLED(i2c, scenes, flip=True)
keyboard.extensions.append(oled)
```

### Keycodes

|Keycode        | Description            |
|---------------|------------------------|
|OLED_TOG       | Turn on/off the screen |
|OLED_NXT       | Next scene             |
|OLED_PRV       | Previous scene         |
